videos.title: FPL CHIP STRATEGY! üçü Double & Blank Gameweeks Confirmed ‚úÖ GW27 Tips #fpl
videos.transcript: You have chips to use in FPL and I'm here to help you choose when to use them. So, let's look at all of the important game weeks. Coming up in gameweek 31, we are going to see a blank gameweek. Arsenal and Wolves will not have a fixture this week and there's a 90% chance that Man City and Crystal Palace won't either. Yes, I said it. There is a 10% chance that City and Palace can still play in gameweek 31, but it would require that Man City be knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle or both teams being knocked out of Europe before the quarterfinals. There will be some temptation to play the free hit here to temporarily move your non-playing players, but you must resist because if you think we will have problems in Gameweek 31, wait until you hear about its big brother, Gameweek 34. Gameweek 34 is going to be the biggest blank gameweek of the season. We are currently predicting that eight teams will have no fixture during that week. Your team is going to be on its knees in gameweek 34. But it gets worse because the teams and the players who will blank in gameweek 34 will be the very same teams and players who will have a double gameweek just one week earlier. So in other words, the kind of players you will want to have in gameweek 33 will be the complete opposite of the players you will want in gameweek 34. You're going to need to make a quick transition between one squad in gameweek 33 and an entirely different one in gameweek 34. Gameweek 34 is going to be amazing with up to 10 teams with two fixtures each. It is going to be pretty much essential to use a wild card or free hit here to manage the transition between these two gameweeks. So, make sure you keep one of those chips in your back pocket. Finally, we have gameweek 36, which has a small chance of being another double gameweek, though the chances are dwindling due to cup ties. There's probably less than 50% chance that this ends up being a double, but maybe an unexpected double can spring up elsewhere. Again, that will depend on cup results that happen in the future, but I'm not from the future. But what I can tell you right now is that it looks like the best chip strategy is to use your transfers to remove blanking players in gameweek 31, ensuring you have 11 playingers. Then wild card in gameweek 32 with loads of double gameweek players ready to bench boost in gameweek 33. Free hit in gameweek 34 to remove all of those same players who are now blanking and triple captain whenever we see another double gameweek. Probably gameweek 36, but maybe elsewhere. No worries if you don't have that chip anymore. If not, just vibes that particular chip if you do still have it. Make sure to follow for more FPL tips and chip strategy. And if you want to know specifically which teams are likely to double and blank, as well as some more chip strategies, I uploaded a fulllength video discussing all of this on the SPLMate YouTube
